Jo B. Hoffman and Joshua Harris Friedman were married last evening by Rabbi Sandy Bogin at the White Space, a loft in Manhattan.

The bride, 31, is a freelance magazine writer based in Brooklyn. She graduated from the University of Wisconsin at Madison. She is a daughter of Gail and Richard Hoffman of Larchmont, N.Y. Her father is the chairman of Hoffman Mills, a home furnishings textiles manufacturer in Manhattan.

Mr. Friedman, also 31, completed a clinical psychology internship in August at the Karen Horney Clinic in Manhattan. Next month he is to become a psychotherapist in the outpatient child and adolescent behavioral health department at Gouverneur Skilled Nursing Facility, Diagnosis and Treatment Center in Manhattan. The bridegroom is a graduate of Colby College. He received a master's degree in child psychology from New York University, where he is a candidate for a doctorate in psychology. He is the son of Laura Friedman and Dr. Robert Friedman of Larchmont. The bridegroom's mother, who is retired, taught art at Community School 47 in the Bronx. His father, a retired dentist, had a practice in the Bronx.
